name: Melia Nassau Beach Resort

reviews.text: we chose the Sheraton for an extended weekend. Here are some facts: the location is beautiful, with calm, clean wide beachfront. There are 2 reefs, teeming with fish (including lionfish). This makes snorkling easy and fun.
reviews.title: beautiful beach.

reviews.text: The rooms are ordinary: our room was clean, and only 4 steps from the elevator. We are Starwood Preferred guests (sign up is free , do it, you get a couple of perks). Our view was unobstructed view of the ocean and pool.
reviews.title: Wonderful trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Get the breakfast for free plan, as the breakfast buffet is a wonderful assortment of anything under the sun.
reviews.title: Nice but it has its faults- please read details- get pen and paper - take notes

reviews.text: The pool bar is very dirty. Other guests have commented. The pool itself needs some repairs, and there was a lot of algae around the bottom of the pool bar stools. The pool bar drinks are watered down, but taste ok. Expensive drinks.. a pina colada is $9.
reviews.title: Great beach - Aweful Food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate dinner outside. Indigo , was in walking distance, and was delicious. We ate at Twin Bros, and Sea food Haven , both at the Fish Fry. We ate at the Poop Deck .
reviews.title: Can't Wait to Return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bahamas is an amazing place perfect beaches and a place you can just relax. The hotel was not bad a typical Sheraton lobby decorated to a high standard but the rooms not so good. The good news is I always look at the picture of my room before I book and had to have the manager out to show them the room then there was no arguement. It was not cheap $400 a night RO. We upgraded to half board they wanted $200 each but negoiated it done to $80 each which was more worth it. Food was ok but everything was very slow. I am from London so used to a fast pace. The first night went to the bar and an American said relax its the Bahamian way and smiled said he was fro NYC and was the same when he arrived wanted a drink pronto but after a week accepted that it takes ten minutes and the service is SLOW... The hotel was ok and would recommend but service is a must for me and you kind of feel a little that the locals feel you should be grateful that they allow you on their island.. Hotel right on the beach though.. Also met some Canadians and Americans that got a lot better deal than us so worth looking in to a package deal....
reviews.title: Not Bad...

reviews.text: So, I am a the type fof traveler that researches and researches before I choose our final destination. I spent hours looking for a place in the Bahamas on Cable Beach. So many of the reviews on the Sheraton were bad. I just returned this evening and couldn't wait to write a review for all of you searching and wondering about the Sheraton.
reviews.title: Amazing Place!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Don't listen to any negative reviews. This hotel was clean, the staff was friendly and the rooms were top notch.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay - Fantastic Hotel and Staff!

reviews.text: 2. The food is expensive, but this is just normal for Bahamas. My sister and I brought nuts and breakfast bars from home and ate that for snacks and such and they you can always share food from the pool hut. The portions are large enough to fill you up.
reviews.title: Just like paradise

reviews.text: 3. People complained about the tip being included. It is perfect. You never have to think about it. Plus if you were raised right, you know that 20 percent is the norm, well here its 15% so it wasn't bad.
reviews.title: Couldn't have had a better stay! Don't believe everything you read about the staff on this site!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I visited the Bahamas over the memorial day weekend - which is officially the first long weekend in the summer- so, we went there expecting that things will be hectic. Yet, we were pleasantly surprised (at least initially) when the immigration lines at the airport weren't that bad and things went smoothly until we reached the hotel.
reviews.title: Moderate Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It took us 1 1/2 hrs to get a room. That was a little ridiculous. Based on the previous reviews, I had expected that there would be a line at check-in, but to wait that long? It was a complete put off. Apparently, due to the long weekend plus the fact that there was some celebrity coming for a show that weekend, the hotel was overbooked and overworked. Sad excuse, because if that's what they expect on such busy weekends then how about preparing for the rush, especially if you claim to be a four star hotel?
reviews.title: Great stay, excellent hotel, nice beach and views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In any case, once our room was assigned, we thought things were going to be okay, but next thing you know, 30 minutes later, someone tries to enter our room. Upon opening the door, we find a couple trying to get in to our room; wasn't their fault, they had just been assigned the room from the front desk.
reviews.title: Good hotel for moderate price -- nice beach and pools

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apart from the lousy head start, everything else was fine. Bimini breakfast was strictly okay...had lots of options, but the quality of the food was a little sub par. Full breakfast options included smoked salmon, croissants, oatmeal, pancakes, waffles, etc. Also tried Dolphin Grill, and would not recommend. Beaches were cool, although there is a weird guy on the beach trying to sell a booze cruise to anyone and everyone...don't know if he's affiliated with Sheraton (?!?). The pools were really nice and pleasant.
reviews.title: Best beach vacation so far!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were nice and comfy. Didn't have any issues in that department.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my husband were quite excited to go to the Bahamas. We didnt stay at the Atlantis because of the ridiculously high prices. So after doing some research and reading on trip advisor we thought Sheraton looked decent enough and booked it.
reviews.title: HORRIBLE - beware of bedbugs and cockroaches
Love it
reviews.text: First impressions were decent - its not too fancy but our check-in was quick and easy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the 5th floor - room 525 but this was the most ridiculously planned layout. After coming out of the elevators, we had to walk through a long corridor, take a left and walk through another long corridor and take another left, and then halfway down that corridor was our room!!! I cannot imagine why they designed it this way but it was very very annoying to go back and forth from our room to the elevators because it took forever.
reviews.title: Not an all-inclusive resort!

reviews.text: The room itself was nothing great. Very mediocre. We had a partial ocean view.
reviews.title: Horrible Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first day was ok, but the second day we saw a cockroach in the room! After many calls to the front desk, we had to get rid of it ourselves. We called them to make sure we didnt find another for the rest of our trip, and if they couldnt do anything about it to change our rooms - however, they really didnt care. They told us they couldnt switch our rooms even though the hotel was not even half booked.
reviews.title: Worst travel experience of my life, horrible resort.

description: Situated on Cable beach, the Sheraton Nassau Beach Resort & Casino offers guests the perfect Bahamas hotel set on 7 acres of stunning waterscape where you can unwind and relax in the tropical weather.
